Convolutive regression best model selection BIC

BICselect.Rd

Convolutive regression best model selection BIC

BICselect(
  df,
  formula.resp,
  idx.pred,
  dist1,
  dist2,
  quiet = TRUE,
  formulas = "main",
  parallel = FALSE,
  interactions = FALSE,
  debug = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

df

dataset
formula.resp

response formula
idx.pred

indices of predictors
dist1

chain of character to idnetify the distribution of variable1
dist2

chain of character to idnetify the distribution of variable2
quiet

logical. Displaying the progress.
formulas

"main" or "all". All includes the variances.
parallel

logical. Should the function run on parallel threads.
interactions

logical. Should the formulas include interactions.
debug

logical. Working option to debug. Dvp.
...

Additional arguments fed into convreg().

Examples

set.seed(123)
e=rnorm(n=50,mean=0,sd=0.05)
x = rnorm(50,0,0.5)
k= rnbinom(50,exp(x),0.5)
y= data.frame(obs= k + e +x, f1 = x, f2 = k, f3 = 2*rnorm(n=50,mean=0,sd=0.05))
form.r = ~obs
df = y
idx.pred = 2
dist1 = "Nbinom"
dist2 = "Gauss"
res= BICselect(df = df, formula.resp = form.r, idx.pred = idx.pred, dist1 = dist1, dist2 = dist2)
#> Number of combinations: 3
head(res,10)
#>   formula1 formula2        BIC
#> 1       ~1      ~f1   6.977019
#> 2      ~f1       ~1 197.063961
#> 3       ~1       ~1 199.857036
